issue.message: Don't include `android.R` here; use a fully qualified name for each usage instead
By convention, the custom view (`MusicAnimationView`) and the declare-styleable (`VusikAttr`) should have the same name (various editor features rely on this convention)
Field requires API level 29 (current min is 19): `android.provider.MediaStore#VOLUME_EXTERNAL_PRIMARY`
The locale folder "`id`" should be called "`in`" instead; see the `java.util.Locale` documentation
Toast created but not shown: did you forget to call `show()`?

To get local formatting use `getDateInstance()`, `getDateTimeInstance()`, or `getTimeInstance()`, or use `new SimpleDateFormat(String template, Locale locale)` with for example `Locale.US` for ASCII dates.

To get local formatting use `getDateInstance()`, `getDateTimeInstance()`, or `getTimeInstance()`, or use `new SimpleDateFormat(String template, Locale locale)` with for example `Locale.US` for ASCII dates.

When you define `paddingStart` you should probably also define `paddingEnd` for right-to-left symmetry
When you define `paddingStart` you should probably also define `paddingEnd` for right-to-left symmetry
When you define `paddingStart` you should probably also define `paddingEnd` for right-to-left symmetry
Use "`Gravity.START`" instead of "`Gravity.LEFT`" to ensure correct behavior in right-to-left locales
Use "`Gravity.END`" instead of "`Gravity.RIGHT`" to ensure correct behavior in right-to-left locales
Consider replacing `android:layout_marginLeft` with `android:layout_marginStart="10dp"` to better support right-to-left layouts
Consider replacing `android:layout_toRightOf` with `android:layout_toEndOf="@+id/pb_progress"` to better support right-to-left layouts
